title: The jungle timer changes aren't bad in themselves. There's another, much larger, issue at hand.
body:
The blue/red timers and spawn markers only widen the gap between solo and premade players. That's the most negative impact this change will have, from what I can see. 

Premades will easily capitalize on spawn times, both aggressively and defensively. Solos will get abused by this change, especially due to the coming mid-lane reliance on blue. 

You're only ostracizing solo players even further with this change, Riot. I hope you realize that.

Actually their survey was pretty genius.
They framed the question in such a way that even those against dynamic queue would answer that they liked it.
what was the survey?

Basically asking if you liked the new champ select if memory serves me right. 

*Which I do, the display of picks front and center is awesome and promotes consideration of what's been picked.*

Honestly though, as far as new champion select goes, I'd rather have the old queue system as well. 

While picking two roles guarantees I will get one of two roles I want, it also ups queue time significantly (not even included the system trying to match for premades).

Another negative is diversity. I mainly top/mid/jungle. I will essentially never practice support or ADC now because the system gives me the roles I want.

The new queue system is convenient and all, but I'm still not sure if its the best thing for the game competitively. 

The pick/ban and pick intent are awesome features of the new champion select, but the champion icons are still too large, IMO. I miss being able to see all of them on one screen without a clunky scroll feature.
Riot did say that they were looking into ways to avoid solo players from going up against or with large premades.

Hey, that sounds like Solo Queue! :^)

Can't avoid the 4+1.

Yeah, I'm aware. Its legitimately an unrealistic promise, though.

In a system that tries not to match solo players with premades, queue times skyrocket for Riot's much preferred premade players. 

I very highly doubt much will be done, as they will prioritize premades' experience over solo players in any system that's a part of Dynamic Queue. Its the unfortunate but inevitable outcome of Riot's current intentions. :(

> [{quoted}](name=Spaceman5pff,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A9hyhAU7,comment-id=000400000002,timestamp=2016-04-21T18:34:58.565+0000)

But there's just as much toxic behavior between premades and solos on the same team. Not to mention gang mentality.

You can't just use arguments against one side. You have to weigh the pros and cons of either option.

Yeah i give a crap.
I take toxicity over solos vs premade+ boosted animals in my elo everyday.
Solo invades by the jungler are the most common form outside of 5 man botside invades. This plain ain't true.

This is going to push more team invades, especially with the newfound importance of blue buffs. 

Remember when Anivia/Ori were meta season 1 and 2? People actively invaded her jungle so she couldn't take blue to mid-lane or team-fights. 

That doesn't happen anymore, but it will now.

I don't see how this change will change much of anything. At higher levels of play, people already estimate buff timers quite accurately. Honestly, this should only affect fringe cases where the jungler leaves his buffs standing around to camp a lane.

This isn't about higher level play. Its that the communication gap is widened at all levels of play, with noticeably larger effect the further down in MMR you go. Even high MMR people have complained about going against premades because they can completely prevent a laner from participating in a game, and jungle is no exception, really. 

This makes it a little easier to pinpoint where a jungler will be... at any level of play. Its much more likely that a team with communication will act on that than ones without.

I could just as easily say that coordinated teams (as of right now) will time the enemy jungler's buff based on when he first appears on the map (and wether top or bot leashes). Consistently doing that every game and timing invades around it properly ... now THAT would require premades.

what? no...it would require a simple pink in the red bush, and another trinket on the blue. 
Invading wasnt the point. It's **countering **an invade with just pings as a solo jungler which gonna be the problem.

What? Lemme get this straight, you're worried about the solo jungler getting invaded and his team not following? If so, that's objectively not an issue. If you get invaded ... leave, there. 2 people on the enemy team wasted as much time and XP as you did.
How many times you actually "left" after being invaded by 2-3 people and not had a nice looking gray screen afterwards.

So if you visit a camp you will gain its timer now? is that what this is about? 

I don't like this change either (even though i steal buffs all the time) 

I honestly don't think people will abuse it as much as this post claims. People in bronze-plat generally dont counter jungle that much, its a risky business where you could get collapsed on.

The issue is less about MMR and more about communication. I don't care if you're in bronze or diamond. If 3 people show up to an enemy buff via real-time communication, chances are the victim's team will not be on top of that situation, and this is especially true the lower you go in MMR. 

These markers tell a member of a premade, of which any one of them might realize, "Hey, his buff is spawning in a minute. We can collapse on him then and their team likely won't be able to react fast enough to stop it." Because that will almost universally be true anywhere below plat.

Yes, your team could take defensive positioning if they think the enemy is going to invade for their buff, but if the jungler is not a part of the premade, realistically, how likely are they to help defend from the invade with the same amount of bodies as the enemy team? Even if they do, will they all be on the same page like the enemy team? If you are a solo jungler, these situations are almost entirely out of your hands. 

That's the issue with these changes.

This change in general is very bad in my opinion. Respawn timer of buffs should only be gain when the enemy is smart enough to get vision of the buff, giving information for free seems stupid and unfair.

In a solo-oriented League of Legends, they're actually positive changes, IMO. 

They encourage counterjungling in lower skill brackets and make it a more defined balance-lever (both ability to both do and defend yourself).

 Counterjungling was something that made jungle experience much more colorful in League's past, and, although I've had my fair share of bad experiences with it, its impact and availability is practically null now, which removes a layer of depth from jungling. 


It makes jungling harder to deal with overall, but there should be a price to pay for essentially bypassing laning.


**This coming from a jungle main who will likely be on the receiving end of these aggression-oriented changes, btw. :)**


The premade vs solo impact it has will be staggering though, and kills all of the positive aspects of these changes in the Dynamic Queue environment.

I think counter jungle shouldn't be encourged by a automatic system, but instead an objective that require player action to contest.

this change will significantly reduce the player skill of many new junglers.

While this argument has merit, it will be argued that its simply unnecessary depth-of-knowledge, which isn't untrue either. 

You can't deny that aggressive vision being almost required for invading (especially after level 1) stops many players from even considering it, though, which doesn't exactly encourage diverse gameplay in regards to interaction with the enemy jungler.

It's not even that hard to counter jungle. Just place a ward in the red or blue pit or somewhere nearby and watch the minimap until it respawns. Why did they feel they needed to add an automatic system for counter jungling. I bet the bronze scrubbies and I won't even use the timers.

I agree that jungle timers on red and blue buff will benefit low ranked players more than high ranked players.
High ranked players are generally more aware of when the buffs on both sides are spawning than low ranked players are.
I think some players will continue to be clueless, but some players (and I mean solo players) are going to make really good use of this information in their games.  So I am not convinced that premades are going to benefit more from this change.

I guess the problem will be people aggressively counterjungling from the lane to deny enemy buffs. If you always have a mid/top + jgl premade controlling your jungle you'll have a problem. This way enemies will be able to prepare a trap while exactly knowing when the buff is up and when the enemy jungle might get there.
Oh yea now that you mention it that's also another downside than what I listed aside from counterjungling being a waste of time and an invalid and useless strategy too.
